### Background
<!-- Provide a concise overview of the rationale behind this change. Include relevant context, prior discussions, or links to related issues. Ensure that the change aligns with the project's overall direction. -->

Upon a thorough review of the existing implementation (#3531), it was discovered that the self-feedback mechanism was not being called as an input. Consequently, the AI was unable to utilize the generated self-feedback for improvement. Additionally, it was observed by me that the feedback prompt was insufficient in providing true feedback, further limiting the AI's potential for growth.

### Changes
<!-- Describe the specific, focused change made in this pull request. Detail the modifications clearly and avoid any unrelated or "extra" changes. -->

Enhanced the self-feedback parsing process to optimize the AI's utilization of feedback for improvement and efficient prompt usage. Modified the feedback_prompt to better align with the task of generating and incorporating feedback, leading to more accurate and appropriate feedback. Additionally, updated the unit test for the self-feedback function to verify the correctness of the generated feedback response and ensure it reflects the input thoughts provided.


### Documentation
<!-- Explain how your changes are documented, such as in-code comments or external documentation. Ensure that the documentation is clear, concise, and easy to understand. -->
I documented my code using inline comments to explain the purpose of each section of the code and to provide additional context where necessary.

### Test Plan
<!-- Describe how you tested this functionality. Include steps to reproduce, relevant test cases, and any other pertinent information. -->

- I tested this functionality by performing the following steps:
- Updated the existing unit test and created a new unit test specifically designed to verify the correctness of the generated feedback response and ensure it reflects the input thoughts provided.
- Set up a sample thoughts dictionary containing keys such as 'reasoning', 'plan', and 'thoughts'.
- Created a fake response that aligns with the updated feedback_prompt.
- Utilized a mocking library to mock the dependencies and isolate the functionality being tested.
- Ran the unit tests locally on my development machine to ensure they passed successfully without any issues.
- Repeated the test with various input thoughts and fake responses to cover different scenarios and edge cases.
- In addition to unit tests, I ran several varying agents locally, such as "make me money" and "autogpt wiki," and tested the self-improvement feature to ensure that it works as intended with different agent configurations.
